q: its top management on Thursday, announcing that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. He would act as an adviser to Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , who would work on strategic projects and new products. The management changes were due to take effect on April

Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening. Early estimates put voting turnout at 94.4 percent. The results of the ballot were expected around 2300 GMT. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday.
